body_html:
@EnricoGiordano1992 If you are trying to make inference time the same across different SessionRun() even if n is smaller, could just use timer then add sleep for each session if needed, e.g. use time.sleep() to control the timing for each session.

The first SessionRun() takes longer than the subsequent ones as the program needs to pass the data.
body_text:
@EnricoGiordano1992 If you are trying to make inference time the same across different SessionRun() even if n is smaller, could just use timer then add sleep for each session if needed, e.g. use time.sleep() to control the timing for each session.
The first SessionRun() takes longer than the subsequent ones as the program needs to pass the data.
body:
@EnricoGiordano1992 If you are trying to make inference time the same across different `SessionRun()` even if n is smaller, could just use timer then add sleep for each session if needed, e.g. use `time.sleep()` to control the timing for each session. 

The first `SessionRun()` takes longer than the subsequent ones as the program needs to pass the data.
